field.value: random thought/polemical: usage of configuration to add extended meta information

field.name: description
field.value:
Sometimes you may want to create an assembly that has common controllers, models and services to reuse them on several distinct web projects. But each web project may have specific approaches to authentication and so on. In this case we could benefit from Windsor integration and allow the user to add extended meta information to a controller. For example
<component id="user.controller" type="Company.Common.Controllers.UserController, Company.Common">
<monorail area="admin"> <filters> <add>MyCookieAuthenticationStrategy</add> </filters> </monorail>
</component>
Maybe it would be simpler to just create an extended UserController on the web project with the filter and area. Don't know. Still, the idea should be evaluated.
